items.title: Dynamic Prompt Fusion for Multi-Task and Cross-Domain Adaptation in LLMs
items.description:

Abstract: This study addresses the generalization limitations commonly observed in large language models under multi-task and cross-domain settings. Unlike prior methods such as SPoT, which depends on fixed prompt templates, our study introduces a unified multi...

items.description:

items.title: Event Causality Identification with Synthetic Control
items.description:
arXiv:2509.18156v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Event causality identification (ECI), a process that extracts causal relations between events from text, is crucial for distinguishing causation from correlation. Traditional approaches to ECI have primarily utilized linguistic patterns and multi-hop ...

items.title: ZERA: Zero-init Instruction Evolving Refinement Agent - From Zero Instructions to Structured Prompts via Principle-based Optimization
items.description:

items.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.
items.description: "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. items.title: mcp-context-forge - A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).
items.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. items.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs.  It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
items.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs.  It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
